title: Meet the 24-year-old CEO who just raised $20m
text:
Education company Crimson has raised $US20 million ($29.5 million) in private capital, bringing its value to $US260 million, from a standing start in 2013 when its chief executive was 18.

'As we've expanded, we've grown beyond college-admission counselling jobs.' Jamie Beaton, 24, chief executive of Crimson.

Crimson, which is based in New Zealand, has extensive operations in Australia and the extra $US20 million will be used to develop operations in Asia.

The company provides coaching and counselling to help domestic students get into top tier global universities such as Princeton, Harvard and Oxford

Some of the additional capital will be used to develop a new business, Crimson Rise, which will teach entrepreneurship, coding and time management to students aged 10 to 14 years.

"As we've expanded, we've grown beyond college-admission counselling jobs. We want to teach tech and data science to a younger group of students and get them thinking about studying overseas," said Crimson's 24-year-old chief executive, Jamie Beaton.
description: Education company Crimson's latest raising brings its value to $US260 million, from a standing start in 2013 when its chief executive was 18.
